medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute respiratory failure due to Escherichia coli sepsis and pneumonia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed acute respiratory failure that progressed after four days of treatment. Initial laboratory studies indicated severe metabolic acidosis with a pH of 7.2 and bicarbonate level of 8.8 mmol per liter. After increasing doses of lorazepam, her acidosis worsened, with a pH dropping to 6.9 despite treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of alcohol abuse, cardiomyopathy, and AIDS.
medical_history.social_history: Use of intravenous lorazepam and history of alcohol abuse.
